anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:07): hi. I have a question pls   
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:07): I'm trying to add some System.out.println's to xwiki-rendering module, but when I build this specific module it doesn't pass the checkstyle tests, and I get:  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:07): [INFO] [checkstyle:checkstyle]  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:07): [INFO] Starting audit...  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:07): anamarias: hi there  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:07): How can I change make it skip ckechstyle ?  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 21:07): Never do System.out  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:08): well, you should be using logs not sysout  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:08): i'm just trying to debug  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:08): for xwiki-core module it worked fine  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:09): where are the logs ? because i didn't find them.   
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:09): why are you not using a debugger to debug?  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:09): eclipse remote debugging?  
jvelociter left at 21:09 ()  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:09): i found only a xwiki.log  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:09): no, i'm not  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:10): well, you should  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:10): it'  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:10): it's very easy  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:10): are you using eclipse?  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:10): i was just thinking i was getting closer and closer to the answer so postponed using it  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:10): yes, i'm on eclipse  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:10): :)  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:10): so  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:10): start your wiki with start\_xwiki\_debug.sh  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:11): then go to eclipse  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:11): click debug button  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:11): (actually arrow)  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:11): and choose debug configurations  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:11): then, say Remote application  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:11): (or smth like this)  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:11): and say you want to connect to port 5005  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:12): (which is what your wiki should say in the command line when started with debug:  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:12): listening to port 5005)  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:12): then add your breakpoints around the code  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:12): and play with xwiki in the browser  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:12): when a breakpoint will be hit, eclipse will ask you if you want to enable debug view or something  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:12): and you say yes and then have fun  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:14): if you have no sources for your classes, click "attach sources" and then workspace project and choose the project containing the sources you want to debug  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:14): (I mean if you have no sources when the breakpoint is hit)  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:15): ok, i created the remote debug configuration  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:15): and added a breakpoint in the code  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:16): but i think the sources are not linked to the classes  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:16): it doesn't matter  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:16): it will break when it hits it  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:16): oh  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:17): and don't forget to start de debug  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:17): the debug  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:17): ah  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 21:17  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:17): after you create it, you need to start debugging  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:17): to have the eclipse connected remotely to the jvm  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:21): wow, it worked !! this is so cool :) thanks  
lucaa - (14/05/2009 21:21): yes, remote debugging is really very fun  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 21:23): especially when you try without it first :)

sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 21:38): Yes

rrodriguez\_ joined #xwiki at 23:16  
rrodriguez left at 23:16 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:17): sdumitriu: hi  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:17): Hi  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:17): i need some help with my issue  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:18): Which one?  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:18): (i'll copy paste my question)  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:18): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3521  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:18): I isolated the problem around this function   
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:18): public List<Block> execute(IncludeMacroParameters parameters, String content, MacroTransformationContext context)  
rrodriguez\_ left at 23:18 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:18): in org.xwiki.rendering.internal.macro.include.IncludeMacro  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 23:18  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:19): it's called when rendering the macros found in the enclosing document  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:19): so in IncludeMacro.execute it does :  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:19): includedContent=this.documentAccessBridge.getDocumentContent(documentName);  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:19): (on line 17 on pastebin http://pastebin.com/ma1998d0)  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:19): it tries to get the content for the included document (the parameter documentName==TestDoc)  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:19): but documentAccessBridge.getDocument() tries to retrieve the document with the current context.   
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:19): to solve the problem we need to get here the content with a new context (with no version set)  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:20): i see there is a executeWithNewContext in IncludeContent, but I'm not sure exactly what it does  
rrodriguez\_ joined #xwiki at 23:20  
rrodriguez left at 23:20 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:21): Let me take a look  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 23:24  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:26): Hm, the problem is a bit tricky  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:28): The whole core is wrong, as it shouldn't treat the revision in there  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:29): So a clean solution is not easy to write  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:29): A good workaround...  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:30): You could change the DefaultDocumentAccessBridge and remove the rev parameter from the context  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:30): (The method that's involved is getDocumentContent)  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:30): where exactly ?  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:30):     public String getDocumentContent(String documentName, String language) throws Exception  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:31): are any other pages calling it  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:31): which are not included  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:31): and should really have the rev no from the context  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:31): ?  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32): String originalRev = context.get("rev");  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32): try {  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32):   context.remove("rev");  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32):   return xcontext.get....  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32): } finally {  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32):   if (originalRev != null) {  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32):     context.put("rev", originalRev);  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32):   }  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32): }  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:32): I don't think there are  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:33): ok, I'll try this  
cypromis left at 23:36 ()

anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:57): sdumitriu: it worked  
anamarias - (14/05/2009 23:57): should I make a patch with it like this ?  
sdumitriu - (14/05/2009 23:58): Yes
